content.title: Cystic Hygroma
content.description: Macrocystic lymphatic malformation typically presenting in neck/axilla

key_concepts.details: Term historically used for macrocystic lymphatic malformation; now often called lymphatic malformation
75% occur in neck (posterior triangle common); may extend into mediastinum
Often detected on prenatal ultrasound; may cause hydrops fetalis if extensive
Sclerotherapy often effective; surgical excision for localized lesions or sclerotherapy failures

content.clinical_significance: Large lesions may cause airway compromise requiring treatment
